lines.text: Barney heard you'd been shot up. He asked after ya.
Yeah, he seemed mighty disappointed when he heard you wasn't buried yet.
Guys like Smitty they don't make anymore!
What's the matter with you, Bill?
I don't like your friends, Murray... Rebstock... Du Sang. I know that Whitey. He's as cruel as a soft-nosed bullet. He'd shoot a dyin' man just to see him sqirm.

[to Smith and Sinclair]
Havin' you two kids together again, I could spit nickles!

[Jokingly]
Go ahead, Bill.

[to Murray giving instructions for the upsoming shootout]
One man behind the rock is worth three in the open.
Murray, if they'd be any other way, I'd a played it differently. You know that, don't you?
[Murray tries to talk]
The only cards I had wee the ones you dealt me.
[Murray smiles and dies]

[Seeing Smith on foot and soaked to the skin]
You sure picked a fine night for a wash. What's the matter? Don't you like horses anymore?
Sure, I had one, but they shot it out from under me.
Smitty! Smitty, we were just talking about you. How are you anyhow?
[kisses Smith on the cheek]
Get away from me, ya big buffalo!
What have you been doing with yourself ?
Hello Baggy. Hi Cap. Well, doc. This is just like coming home.
Come here, sweetheart, let me look at you. Boy its good to see you!
You too, Murray.
Here, let me help you off with these wet things.
[takes Smith's bag off his shoulder]
